sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#events"}}>{`Events`}</MDXTag><MDXTag name="ul" components={components} parentName="li">
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#using-an-emitter"}}>{`Using an emitter`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"#emitter-principles"}}>{`Emitter principles`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"events"}}>{`Events`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"using-an-emitter"}}>{`Using an emitter`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`In order to keep components as flexible and reusable as possible for differing projects, abstracting all events that require processing into a data stream and then adding subscribers to those streams is the angle to take projects.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"emitter-principles"}}>{`Emitter principles`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Define a schematic for what sort of streams can happen and allow them to be flexible enough so that within the subscriptions then listeners can be specific about their task. I.e. if you need to add a user, ensure the stream can cater to listeners that handle posting data to analytics on the user, posting data to different databases etc.`}</MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
